title: (x) 'myndology' logo: round sans - various alternatives {Riccardo}
content:
Any help is appreciated.  
thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Myndology\_Large.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/typophile.com/files/Myndology_Large.jpg) | 19.79 KB |
author: scarchord

comments.content:
I thought that that g and y style of descender was pretty common among Bauhaus/geometric style typefaces. But I was wrong. Even the extensive alternate-rich Mark Simonson's Mostra Nuova ( [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra-nuova/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra-nuova/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra-nuova/")), which features a similar g, doesn't offer the right y (a feature for Mostra Nuovissima, Mark? ;-)  
For typeface in the style you can peruse Mike Yanega's Bauhaus-style Font ID Guide ( [http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html "http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html")).  
Here's some suggestion for similar construction:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/cubo/cyclo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/cubo/cyclo/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/cubo/cyclo/")  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/atype/scripio-a-simple/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/atype/scripio-a-simple/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/atype/scripio-a-simple/")  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/register-sans-btn/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/register-sans-btn/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/register-sans-btn/")

That said, if it's just for something quick & dirt...  
 [http://www.dafont.com/cyclo.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202050305/http:/www.dafont.com/cyclo.font "http://www.dafont.com/cyclo.font")
I think this is a not very well executed custom job.
